basics.name: Justin Chadwell
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Computer Science Student working on awesome projects

highlights: Wrote C and A64/A32 to add support for next-gen ARM security features in firmware.
Improved build processes and tests for Trusted Firmware A in the OSS group.
Presented to engineers in the Open Source Software Group about using the Undefined Behavior Sanitizer in firmware, an area I researched while interning.
Promoted Context IS to students at the University of Birmingham.
Attended conferences to represent the company, interacted with potential hires and shared job opportunities with graduates.
Worked with the Service Level Agreement team to deliver consistent, quality output.
Constructed unit tests, documented internal APIs and generated monitoring graphs.
Helped plan and organize a hackathon of over 250 attendees.
Built and deployed a number of web services to enhance attendee experience.
Designed and ran a CTF, accessible to attendees of all ages and skill levels.
Represented the university in CTFs, as 2nd highest ranked UK University team.
Developed CTFs for UoB’s School of Computer Science and INRIA’s SILM summer school.
Designed and created challenges spanning multiple areas within cybersecurity.
Managed infrastructure hosted on Google Cloud Platform.
Represented the university in CTFs, as 2nd highest ranked UK University team.

awards.title: Computer Science School Undergraduate Prize
awards.summary: Awarded for achieving the highest combined weighted average in first year Computer Science.

awards.title: EPS Event of the Year (nomination)
awards.summary: Nominated for WhatTheCTF 2019, a custom-built cybersecurity competition designed by students for students.

awards.title: Academic Excellence Award
awards.summary: Awarded for excellence and outstanding performance in studied subjects.

awards.title: Leadership Award
awards.summary: Awarded for contributions to the local community, including volunteer trips to local villages and co-leading the student council
